transcripts.text: And Wigner's famous comment about the unreasonable effectiveness of mathematics kind of elicits a desire to probe what that means. Well, it's uncanny how powerful mathematics is in understanding physics.  So I think Eugene Wigner had in mind the fact that on the one hand, to understand the equations of physics, you need to know a surprising amount of rather sophisticated math.  But on the other hand, the equations of physics are mathematically interesting.  So mathematics is the language in which the laws of physics are formulated and in terms of which they have to be studied.
